title: Rule of Thirds
description: Divide the image into 9 equal parts using 2 horizontal and 2 vertical lines. Place key elements along these lines or at their intersections for balanced composition.
best_practice: Position focal points (faces, products, CTAs) at intersection points. Avoid centering subjects unless intentional symmetry is desired.
examples: Instagram posts with subjects at intersections achieve 30% higher engagement

title: Color Psychology for Social Media
description: Colors evoke specific emotions: Blue (trust, calm), Red (urgency, excitement), Green (growth, health), Yellow (optimism, attention), Purple (luxury, creativity), Orange (enthusiasm, action).
best_practice: Use 60-30-10 rule: 60% dominant color, 30% secondary, 10% accent. Ensure colors align with brand identity and desired emotional response.
examples: Blue increases LinkedIn CTR by 23%, Red increases urgency perception by 40%
metrics: +23% CTR on professional platforms, +80% brand recognition

title: F-Pattern Eye Tracking
description: Users scan content in an F-shaped pattern: horizontal scan at top, second horizontal scan lower, vertical scan on left side. Critical for text-heavy designs.
best_practice: Place most important information in top-left quadrant. Position CTAs along left side or at F-pattern hotspots.
examples: Designs following F-pattern see 35% better information retention

title: Z-Pattern Layout
description: For minimal text designs, eyes move in Z-shape: top-left to top-right, diagonal to bottom-left, then to bottom-right. Ideal for landing pages and ads.
best_practice: Logo top-left, value proposition top-right, secondary info middle-left, CTA bottom-right.
examples: Z-pattern ads show 42% higher conversion rates

title: White Space (Negative Space)
description: Empty space around elements that provides visual breathing room. Increases readability, focus, and perceived luxury.
best_practice: Use at least 30% white space for premium feel. Avoid cluttering. Let important elements breathe.
examples: Designs with 40%+ white space perceived as 25% more premium

title: WCAG Contrast Ratios
description: Minimum contrast ratio of 4.5:1 for normal text, 3:1 for large text (18pt+). Ensures readability for visually impaired users.
best_practice: Use online contrast checkers. Aim for AA standard minimum, AAA (7:1) for critical text. Never use light gray on white.
examples: WCAG AA compliance increases readership by 50% across demographics

title: Typographic Hierarchy
description: Clear distinction between headings, subheadings, body text, and captions through size, weight, and spacing.
best_practice: Use 3-4 hierarchy levels maximum. Heading 2-3x larger than body. Line height 1.5x font size for body text.
examples: Clear hierarchy improves scanability by 60%

title: Golden Ratio (1:1.618)
description: Mathematical ratio found in nature that creates aesthetically pleasing proportions. Used for layout divisions, image cropping, typography sizing.
best_practice: Divide layouts using 1:1.618 ratio. Use for column widths, image dimensions, font size relationships.
examples: Golden ratio designs rated 40% more aesthetically pleasing

title: Color Harmony Schemes
description: Complementary (opposite on wheel), analogous (adjacent), triadic (equidistant), monochromatic (single hue variations).
best_practice: Complementary for high contrast/attention, analogous for harmony, triadic for vibrancy, monochromatic for elegance.
examples: Harmonious palettes increase visual appeal by 45%

title: CTA Button Optimization
description: Call-to-action buttons should be visually distinct, action-oriented, and appropriately sized (minimum 44x44px for touch).
best_practice: Use contrasting colors, action verbs (Get, Start, Join vs Learn More), sufficient padding, clear hover states.
examples: Optimized CTAs show 90% higher click-through rates

title: Visual Weight & Balance
description: Larger, darker, more colorful elements carry more visual weight. Balance prevents designs from feeling lopsided.
best_practice: Distribute visual weight evenly or intentionally. Use symmetrical balance for formal feel, asymmetrical for dynamic feel.
examples: Balanced designs reduce cognitive load by 30%

title: Instagram Optimal Dimensions
best_practice: Use 4:5 for feed posts (more screen real estate), 9:16 for Stories/Reels. Keep text within safe zones (top/bottom 250px).
examples: 4:5 posts get 23% more engagement than 1:1

title: Facebook 20% Text Rule (Deprecated but Effective)
description: While Facebook removed the 20% text rule for ads, images with less text still perform better.
best_practice: Keep text minimal on images. Use overlays sparingly. Put detailed copy in post text instead.
examples: Images with <10% text see 45% better reach

title: LinkedIn Professional Design Standards
description: Clean, professional aesthetic with corporate color schemes. Data visualizations and infographics perform well.
best_practice: Use blue/gray color schemes, san-serif fonts, data-driven content. Avoid overly casual or flashy designs.
examples: Professional designs get 2.3x more engagement on LinkedIn

title: Mobile-First Responsive Design
description: 80%+ of social media users access platforms on mobile. Designs must work perfectly on small screens.
best_practice: Design for 375x667px (iPhone SE) minimum. Use large touch targets (44px+), readable fonts (16px+ body), clear CTAs.
examples: Mobile-optimized designs show 73% higher conversion

title: Gestalt Principle: Proximity
description: Elements close together are perceived as related. Group related items, separate unrelated ones.
best_practice: Use consistent spacing. Group related text/images closely (8-12px), separate sections with larger gaps (24-48px).
examples: Proper grouping improves information processing by 40%

title: Font Pairing Best Practices
description: Combining typefaces effectively: contrast (serif + sans-serif), consistent mood, limited to 2-3 fonts maximum.
best_practice: Pair serif headings with sans-serif body, or geometric sans with humanist sans. Use font weight variation for hierarchy.
examples: Good font pairing increases readability by 35%

title: Directional Visual Cues
description: Arrows, lines, eye gaze, pointing gestures direct user attention to important elements like CTAs.
best_practice: Use subtle arrows or lines to guide eyes to CTA. Show person looking at product. Use diagonal lines for movement.
examples: Directional cues increase CTA clicks by 52%

title: Social Proof Visual Integration
description: Testimonials, user counts, ratings, verified badges, press logos build trust and credibility.
best_practice: Show real faces in testimonials, use star ratings, display user counts (10K+ users), add trust badges.
examples: Social proof increases conversion by 63%

title: Urgency & Scarcity Design Elements
description: Limited time offers, countdown timers, low stock indicators, exclusive access create FOMO.
best_practice: Use red/orange for urgency, show timers, display 'Only X left', add 'Limited time' badges.
examples: Urgency indicators boost conversions by 55%

title: Brand Visual Consistency
description: Consistent use of colors, fonts, logo placement, imagery style across all posts builds recognition.
best_practice: Create brand guidelines: color palette (3-5 colors), 2-3 fonts, logo placement rules, photo filter/style.
examples: Consistent branding increases recognition by 80%

title: Video Thumbnail Best Practices
description: Eye-catching first frame with clear subject, text overlay, high contrast determines video play rate.
best_practice: Show faces with emotion, use bold text overlay, create curiosity gap, maintain brand consistency.
examples: Optimized thumbnails increase play rate by 70%

title: Emotional Color Associations
description: Red: excitement/danger, Blue: trust/calm, Green: nature/go, Yellow: caution/optimism, Black: luxury/power, Purple: creativity.
best_practice: Match colors to desired emotion. Financial = blue/green, Food = red/yellow, Luxury = black/gold, Eco = green/brown.
examples: Emotionally aligned colors increase message retention by 40%

title: Modern Minimalist Design
description: Clean layouts, ample white space, simple color palettes, bold typography, focused messaging.
best_practice: Remove non-essential elements, use 2-3 colors maximum, large typography, single focal point.
examples: Minimalist designs rated 50% more modern and trustworthy

title: Alt Text & Image Descriptions
description: Descriptive alternative text for images helps screen readers and improves SEO.
best_practice: Describe what's in image (objects, people, text), explain context, keep under 125 characters, avoid 'image of'.
examples: Proper alt text increases reach to 15% more users

title: Visual Storytelling in Carousels
description: Multi-image posts that tell a story or build anticipation increase swipe-through rates.
best_practice: Start with hook, build narrative, end with payoff/CTA. Use consistent design theme. Create curiosity gaps.
examples: Story-driven carousels get 2.1x more swipes

title: Modern Gradient Usage
description: Smooth color transitions, duotones, gradient overlays on photos create contemporary aesthetic.
best_practice: Use subtle gradients (2-3 colors), overlay at 30-50% opacity, ensure text contrast maintained.
examples: Gradient overlays increase perceived modernity by 45%

title: Data Visualization & Infographics
description: Charts, graphs, icons, and visual data representations make complex information digestible.
best_practice: Use bar charts for comparisons, line for trends, pie for proportions. Keep simple, label clearly.
examples: Infographics generate 3x more engagement than text posts

title: User-Generated Content Aesthetic
description: Authentic, unpolished, real-person photos build trust more than stock photography.
best_practice: Use real customer photos, show behind-scenes, avoid overly staged shots, include imperfections.
examples: UGC-style content shows 85% higher trust and 28% higher engagement

title: Subtle Motion & Micro-interactions
description: Small animations, parallax effects, hover states, loading animations enhance user experience.
best_practice: Keep animations under 300ms, use easing functions, provide visual feedback for interactions.
examples: Micro-animations increase perceived quality by 60%
